laboratory_examinations.findings: Undetectable (<0.5 ng per milliliter) 3 months after prostatectomy; elevated at 17.2 ng per milliliter 18 months after prostatectomy.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: PSA level increased from undetectable (<0.5 ng/mL) to 17.2 ng/mL over 18 months.
Femoral neck decreased to 0.65 g/cm² (T score, -2.1) and total hip to 0.84 g/cm² (T score, -1.2) over 3 years.
